intro: Glomeraria bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored glomeraria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Glomeraria bicolor thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
